fields.name: NOTICE_DATE
fields.doc: date and time of notice creation

fields.name: SRC_RA
fields.doc: RA to which the spacecraft will point after this slew in J2000 epoch [deg]

fields.name: SRC_DEC
fields.doc: Dec to which the spacecraft will point after this slew in J2000 epoch [deg]

fields.name: SLEW_TIME
fields.doc: SOD when the next s/c slew starts

fields.name: SLEW_DATE
fields.doc: TJD when the next s/c slew starts

fields.name: OBS_TIME
fields.doc: the amount of time the s/c will observe that new location [sec]

fields.name: TGT_NAME
fields.doc: name of the object that the sc will be observing next

fields.name: TGT_NUM
fields.doc: string of alpha and digits uniquely identifying event

fields.name: SEG_NUM
fields.doc: Swift serial number (for Swift notice types only)

fields.name: MERIT
fields.doc: total calculated value for the given burst expected range from about -100 to +300

fields.name: BAT_MODE
fields.doc: flagbits. They determine how each instrument responds for data-taking for each AT burst response

fields.name: XRT_MODE
fields.doc: flagbits. They determine how each instrument responds for data-taking for each AT burst response

fields.name: UVOT_MODE
fields.doc: flagbits. They determine how each instrument responds for data-taking for each AT burst response

fields.name: MISC_19
fields.doc: 32 Flag Bits. See https://gcn.gsfc.nasa.gov/sock_pkt_def_doc.html for definition of bits, some bits may not be defined
